page.title: 01GLENALMOND COLLEGE
page.content: The{River Almond}in its Logie stage, borders this D-block to the North; to the South lies Keillour Forest and to the East Drumbuich Wood: the Western edge is bordered by a 9-hole golf course and some heathland. The population is about 650 of which 600 live and work in the{Glenalmond {College}estate. Apart from the scattered farms the College dominates the life of this block and with 380 boys and 40 masters it is a male-orientated establishment. Founded in{1847}as a Theological College the school soon evolved into a {boys' boarding school}and through its facilities and the provision of employment strong links are preserved with the wider community outside of its estate. What follows evaluates College life and its relationship with neighbouring farms.
